text: The sushi is average and the prices are anything but .
Ambiance and music funky , which I enjoy .
Service was slow had to wait to order and get food although not crowded .
However , I think this place is a good hang out spot .
The atmosphere is n't the greatest , but I suppose that 's how they keep the prices down .
They do n't seem to place an emphasis on specials or fresh ingredients which to me is necessary for good thai .
The menu choices are similar but the taste lacked more flavor than it looked .
While Sapphire is certainly not lacking in ambiance , and probably has the best decor of any Indian restaurant I have been to in New York City , the food was not what I had hoped for .
not the food , not the ambiance , not the service , I agree with the previous reviews you wait and wait , the wait staff are very rude and when you get in they are looking to get you right out .
Oh yes , and they lie on the phone , claiming they have seating in the garden , then of course the seats are not available .
It 's also attached to Angel 's Share , which is a cool , more romantic bar ...
The strong scents coming from the left and right of me negatively affected my taste buds .
And forget what you read under me , the atmosphere is n't that bad either .
